column3: well a great time the weather good and it was a pleasure to take the time to visit well worth to go we had a great time

This is a very nice small park overlooking the beach. It is quiet, uncrowded, has lovely benches and lots of green space. I stopped here and just sat...taking in the breeze and the lovely view. It was a lovely and serene place in which to escape.Probably the only drawback is the lack of parking close by.

This is a great spot for beach party get together. There is parking. Not a lot. But we usually get a spot. Easy walk down to beach.Note. Parking kit closes at 8pm and they chain it up. You are locked in until the next morning.If you arrive at 1pm. Park up on highland. It will be packed. Especially if a weekendHave fun. Follow us @nickellfamilytravel
This is a site where black residents were kicked out to make a park. The sand in Hermosa is better and the surf is better in El Porto most days

This is a nice small park on a steep hill right by the beach. There are benches, a basketball court and seems a lot of people like bringing their dogs here which is cool. Great views of the ocean and a really nice chill spot to relax.

column2: Beautiful memories were made here when my daughter was an infant.
column3: Back in the early 70's I would bring my infant daughter to Bruce's Beach and spend an hour or so reading to her. She wasn't one year old yet. We came weekly until she was about four years old. It was named Culligan Park at the time. I eventually learned the history of the park and shared it with her when she was an adult. I visited the park just two weeks ago and whammy....the memories came flooding in. Bruce's Beach is such a peaceful spot. We would lie down on the grass and look up into the sky trying to find "animals" in the clouds or people watch. It's so nice to have such wonderful memories with my first child.

column2: Nice little park, close to the beach
column3: Bruces Beach is a very nice little park, close to the beach. But like all grass in MB, dogs will do their business on it. Then people want to lay in it?

column2: Nice green space overlooking the beach
column3: Bruce's Beach is a nice grassy area between The Strand and Highland Ave that overlooks the beach and water. There are several benches throughout and an outside workout area near The Strand.
We walk here a lot. The views are lovely and it is very relaxing. It's only a couple of blocks to the beach where there are restaurants galore and more great walking.
Nice grassy area with ocean view, not really that near the beach. Parking not readily available, pass by often. I wouldn't go out of my way to stop.

column2: Fabulous views in the Heart of Manhattan Sand Section
column3: Watch the sunset... watch the surfers... Enjoy the expanded views from Malibu south... A great place to stop and just enjoy the day!

column2: Nice parkette, a block from the beach.
column3: This is a nice small park, only a block away from the beach. Parking can be difficult. For those looking for a place for a picnic, with a view of the ocean (but without that pesky sand), this is nice, but only about half of the park is flat--the rest slopes down towards the ocean.

column2: Proof there is grass in Manhattan Beach
column3: Large park by Manhattan Beach standards but actually pretty small. There is a nice view of the ocean from here.
Lots of dog poo everywhere. Also crap from humans playing yoga.This place is not for everyone....if you hate dogs don't go.

column2: Nice park - it's not a beach
column3: Located between 26th and 27th Streets, and Highland and Manhattan Aves, this is a grass park with fabulous views of the beach and ocean. Closer to Highland there are a few shade trees and a couple of benches where you can relax and take in the spectacular view of the beach. Below, as you move closer to Manhattan Avenue, there are a couple of basketball hoops, and below those is an open grass area where dogs are welcome as long as they are on leash. If you aren't up for the trek down to the sand/ocean this park is a nice place for a picnic. Below Manhattan Avenue there is metered parking in two small lots, otherwise you have to be lucky to find street parking, which in the summer is always a challenge. It's a nice park, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get to it - it's more of a stopping off point rather than a destination.
